sen.j: 大江山口内宮駅（おおえやまぐちないくえき）は、京都府福知山市大江町 (京都府)内宮にある、北近畿タンゴ鉄道(KTR)北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Oeyamaguchinaiku Station is located in Oe-cho, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture and is a railway station on the Miyafuku Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation (KTR).
Oeyamaguchinaiku Station, located in Oe-cho, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway station on the Miyafuku Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation (KTR).
Oeyamaguchi-naiku Station, located in Naiku, Oe-cho (Kyoto Prefecture), Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway station on the Miyafuku Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).

sen.j: 駅名の由来は、元伊勢内宮皇大神社である。
sen.e: The station name is derived from Motoise Naiku Kotai-jinja Shrine.
The station name is derived from Motoise Naiku Kotai-jinja Shrine.
The station name is derived from Motoise Naiku Kotai-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station Construction
The station's structure
Station layout
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 宮津方から見て線路は南に伸び、東へカーブしている。
sen.e: Looked at from the Miyazu direction, the tracks head South and curve to the East.
The tracks, when viewed from the Miyazu direction, head south and curve toward the east.
The tracks, when viewed from the Miyazu direction, head south and curve toward the east.

sen.j: プラットホーム形状と配置1面2線を有する。
sen.e: The single platform arrangement has 2 lines.
The single platform arrangement has two lines.
It has a single platform serving two tracks.

sen.j: 配線は一線スルーだが、全体的にカーブしているため通過列車でも85km/hの制限を受ける。
sen.e: The lines pass through but because they have an overall curve, an 85 km/h speed limit is imposed even on trains that pass through without stopping.
The lines pass through, but because they're generally curved a speed limit of 85 km/h is imposed, even on trains that pass through without stopping.
The lines pass through, but because they're generally curved a speed limit of 85 km/h is imposed, even on trains that pass through without stopping.

sen.e: Station Vicinity

Station surroundings
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 山間の谷に位置し、西側は京都府道が並行する。
sen.e: Located in a valley between mountains, the West side runs parallel to a Kyoto prefectural road.
Located in a valley between mountains, the west side runs parallel to a Kyoto prefectural road.
Located in a valley between mountains, the west side runs parallel to a Kyoto prefectural route.
sen.cmt: 府道→prefectural route としました。
